snippet: The move was a return to a tactic used by President Hosni Mubarak, in which governorships are dangled to cultivate top officers’ loyalty while extending the police state’s grip.
abstract: Egypt's military-appointed government names roster of generals as provincial governors, raising fears of authoritarianism; move is return to tactic used by President Hosni Mubarak, in which governorships are dangled to cultivate top officers’ loyalty while extending the police state’s grip.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: The move was a return to a tactic used by President Hosni Mubarak, in which governorships are dangled to cultivate top officers’ loyalty while extending the police state’s grip.

headline.main: Appointment of 19 Generals as Provincial Governors Raises Fears in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Appointment of 19 Generals as Provincial Governors Raises Fears in Egypt

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
